Wisdom.quote: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom, and knowledge of the Holy One is understanding. (Proverbs 9:10)

Perseverance.quote: Fall seven times, stand up eight. (Japanese Proverb)

Patience.quote: Patience is a tree whose root is bitter, but its fruit is very sweet. (Persian Proverb)

Preparation.quote: Dig the well before you are thirsty. (Chinese Proverb)

Knowledge.quote: To know the road ahead, ask those coming back. (Chinese Proverb)

Action.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step. (Lao Tzu)

Opportunity.quote: When the wind of change blows, some build walls, others build windmills. (Chinese Proverb)

Consequences.quote: As you sow, so shall you reap. (Biblical, Galatians 6:7)

Self-Reliance.quote: God helps those who help themselves. (Aesop's Fables)

Time.quote: Time waits for no one. (English Proverb)

Perspective.quote: The grass is always greener on the other side of the fence. (American Proverb)

Contentment.quote: A bird in hand is worth two in the bush. (English Proverb)

Adversity.quote: Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors. (African Proverb)

Discernment.quote: All that glitters is not gold. (Shakespeare, The Merchant of Venice)

Unity.quote: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together. (African Proverb)

Excellence.quote: The excellence of a gift lies in its appropriateness rather than in its value. (Charles Dudley Warner)

Courage.quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear. (Plato)

Persistence.quote: A falling drop at last will carve a stone. (Lucretius)

Forgiveness.quote: To err is human, to forgive divine. (Alexander Pope)

Honesty.quote: Honesty is the best policy. (Benjamin Franklin)

Gratitude.quote: When eating bamboo sprouts, remember the man who planted them. (Chinese Proverb)

Experience.quote: Experience is the best teacher. (Latin Proverb)

Humility.quote: Pride goeth before destruction, and a haughty spirit before a fall. (Proverbs 16:18)

Generosity.quote: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted. (Aesop)

Friendship.quote: A friend in need is a friend indeed. (Latin Proverb)

Silence.quote: Speech is silver, silence is golden. (Swiss Proverb)
